Detailed Description

A base class for the descriptor of a data channel.

Member Function Documentation

◆ AddData()

virtual void tsa::ChannelDescriptor::AddData ( )
inlinevirtual

This function must be called when there are not enough data to fill the output view. In this base class does nothing.

Reimplemented in tsa::FRAMEH_Channel, tsa::SER_Channel, tsa::SIM_Channel, tsa::PROC_Channel, and tsa::ADC_Channel.

Definition at line 118 of file FrameIStream.hpp.

◆ data_available()

bool tsa::ChannelDescriptor::data_available ( double  t)
protected

Check the availability of a value at a given time, looking in the set of registered data losses. Remove from this set all the exceptions which correspond to times lower than t.

Parameters
trequested time
Returns
true if a number is available at the given time, false otherwise

◆ PushFrVect()

void tsa::ChannelDescriptor::PushFrVect ( FrVect *  frv,
double  t,
unsigned int  off,
double  offset,
double  slope 
)
protected

Call

See also
Queue for a sequence of numerical values. The values are contained inside a FrVect, starting from a given offset. The effective value which is passed to
Queue is given by y=offset+slope*x, where x is the value contained in the FrVect.
Parameters
frvpointer to the FrVect containing data
ttime corresponding to the first data contained in the FrVect (neglecting the offset)
offoffset in the FrVect
offsetan optional offset to correct the data
slopean optional scaling factor to correct the data

See also
Queue n times, passing the given value and the corresponding time.
Parameters

nnumber of copies of the data that must be added

Definition at line 60 of file FrameIStream.cpp.

◆ Queue()

void tsa::ChannelDescriptor::Queue ( double  v,
double  t 
)
protected

Push a given value v, at the given time t, in the output queue. The value is pushed only if its time is larger or equal that the current mNextTime. If it is larger that the current mNextTime value a data loss is registered.

The value of mNextTime is updated.

Parameters
vthe value
tthe time

Definition at line 34 of file FrameIStream.cpp.

◆ WriteView() [1/2]

void tsa::ChannelDescriptor::WriteView ( SeqViewDouble &  v)
virtual

A function to write the available data on an output view. Be careful that if there are not enough data available we get a data loss exception.

Parameters
voutput view where the available data are written

Definition at line 149 of file FrameIStream.cpp.

◆ WriteView() [2/2]

void tsa::ChannelDescriptor::WriteView ( SeqViewDouble &  v,
SeqViewDouble &  validation 
)
virtual

A function to write the available data on an output view. Be careful that if there are not enough data available we get a data loss exception. At the same time a second view is filled with ones which correspond to avaliable data, or zeros which correspond to unavailable data.

Parameters
voutput view where the available data are written
validationoutput view where the available data flags are written
